title: Mapping The Birds Of Bougainville Island
description: In the early 1900s, the Whitney South Sea expedition gathered 40,000 bird specimens for the American Museum of Natural History. The collection is an irreplaceable snapshot of avian diversity in the South Pacific, but is missing key geographic data. To solve this mystery, student researchers dug into field journals to determine where birds from one island came from.

itunes:summary: Teen scientists dig into the archives to revitalize an 100-year-old dataset of South Pacific birds
